Posts.Content: As you say, one day at a time! I'm at same stage as you, waiting for surgical date. Well done for continuing at work; distraction is great but it is ok to scream, cry, behave erratic, laugh but put yourself first. I'm saying all this as a nurse but am not heeding my own advice; write down notes, take someone to appointments, dont read too much online unless fab groups like this. You dont have to be strong for others, thats their responsibility. contact me again if u want a rant or if u have questions - am here.

Posts.Content: Hi justlittleme, i'm slightly further on than you, 26 days post op, pathology results good, no lymph involvement, no radio reqd but said i might need chemo, seeing oncologist on thurs (dreading it), starting tamoxifen in 4 weeks! I'm moving much easier every day, abdo tightens as day goes on so am eating small amounts & avoiding bloating but generally healing well. Keep in touch x
Posts.Title: Recovery after mastectomy/diep

Posts.Content: Hey, am 3 weeks post op; only last few days am feeling a bit like my old self! Very restricted in what i can do, abdo very tight, boobs very tender, the itch/tingling feeling which i assume is the healing process isnt the nicest sensation! I cant concentrate on reading but beginning to think about arranging some visitors! As everyone says, we are all different and just need to take one day at a time! Pathology results for me 2norrow so that'll be another hurdle! Be kind to yourself!
Posts.Title: Recovery after mastectomy/diep

Posts.Content: 12 days post op for me (bilateral); all replies lip balm, ear plugs, dry shampoo, big pants are great; my only issue was that i only took 2 total support bras, one cup size down from my pre-op size (advised bt BCN) but i needed a larger back and smaller cup! Hubby did a great job trying to source but with hols and stock sizes, i wish i'd bought a couple more (kept tags & receipts) as my surgeon requested a bra on asap to be worn 24hours, i needed a few changes due to slight soakage! Good luck
Posts.Title: What to take to hospital?

Posts.Content: Nearly 2 weeks post bilat mastectomy with diep flap recon. All wounds healing well. Can anyone tell me if their abdomen was extremely tight? If i get slightly bloated, eat or drink a little bit too much then extra pain meds needed. Am doing my exercises as advised! Any help appreciated!
Posts.Title: Tight abdomen

Posts.Content: Up this morning and not so tight; changes to diet and to lose a bit weight wont do me any harm! Will mention it at next appt! Thanks for your reply!
Posts.Title: Tight abdomen

Posts.Content: Hi, dont freak out, chill and enjoy your time! This is post op day 10 for me; bilat & diep! I got a couple of overnight passes for xmas. Days 1&2 were hard but each day after gets easier. I long to hug my kids but cant the way i used to at the moment but it will return.  I'm a theatre nurse and know this op is performed regularly. You will get the best care and attention; just do everything you are told and your little one will be back on your lap in no time. I feel if it were me today, i'd manage a little careful cuddle; think my family appreciate me more now ive been away. Focus on getting through one day at a time. Good luck x
Posts.Title: 5 days till surgery and starting to freak out...

Posts.Content: Grrrrrrrr. I'm exactly the same as you; so many folk said "but you look great", "youre not feeling unwell", "i had a lump but its nothing" - omg, wish they could see my scars & only imagine half the psychological stress we all go through!!!!!! As some people say if you dont have anything decent to say, dont say anything at all...xxx
Posts.Title: Your cancer wasn't bad then....

Posts.Content: Hi, am nearly 6 weeks post bilat mastectomy with diep recon! Am healing well, can do almost everything as before! Still have tightness if over stretch arms and loads of numb areas to abdo but apart from tiredness am fine. Signed off till March/April as a nurse & still waiting to hear about chemo! Implants not an option as surgeon advised tumors were large & implant wldnt sit well! Good luck x
